    • Constructor Detail

      • PaintWindow_GU2

        public PaintWindow_GU2(int width,
                       int height,
                       java.lang.String title,
                       java.awt.Color backgroundColor)
        Shows a window with title and background color. The size of the window is width x height.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the window
        height - height of the window
        title - title of the window
        backgroundColor - background color of the window

      • PaintWindow_GU2

        public PaintWindow_GU2(int width,
                       int height,
                       int backgroundWidth,
                       int backgroundHeight,
                       java.lang.String title,
                       java.awt.Color backgroundColor)
        Shows a window with title and background color. (width x height) is the dimension of the window. The window is located at the upper left corner of the background.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the window
        height - height of the window
        backgroundWidth - width of the background. The width of the background may be greater than width of the window.
        backgroundHeight - height of the background. The height of the background may be greater than height of the window.
        title - title of the window
        backgroundColor - Icon (image) in the background of the window. The size of the icon (image) can be larger than the window

      • PaintWindow_GU2

        public PaintWindow_GU2(int width,
                       int height,
                       java.lang.String title,
                       javax.swing.Icon background,
                       int cameraX,
                       int cameraY)
        Shows a window with title and background image. The size of the window is width x height. And the size of the background image can be larger than than the window.
        Parameters:
        width - width of the window
        height - height of the window
        title - title of the window
        background - Icon (image) in the background of the window. The size of the icon (image) can be larger than the window
        cameraX - window location on the background image. cameraX indicates where the window's left edge is the background image.
        cameraY - window location on the background image. cameraY indicates where the window's top edge is the background image.

      • addIcon

        public void addIcon(javax.swing.Icon icon,
                    int x,
                    int y,
                    boolean visible)
        Adds an icon (image) to the window. The upper left corner of the window will be at the coordinates (x,y) in the background.
        Parameters:
        icon - the icon
        x - icon location on the background. x indicates where the window's left edge is on the background
        y - image location on the background image. x indicates where the window's left edge is on the background
        visible - visible determines whether the icon to appear or not

      • addText

        public void addText(Text text,
                    int x,
                    int y)
        Adds text to the window. The text will appear as an image with the same properties as an image. x indicates where text's left edge is on the background and y indicates where the text's top edge is on the background
        Parameters:
        text - the Text-object to add to the window
        x - x-coordinate of left side of the text
        y - y_coordinate of the top of the text

      • removeIcon

        public void removeIcon(javax.swing.Icon icon)

        Parameters:
        icon - the icon

        public void setIconXY(javax.swing.Icon icon,
                      int x,
                      int y)
        Moves the icon to position (x,y) where x is x coordinate of the left side of the icon and y is y coordinate of the upper side of the icon
        Parameters:
        icon - the icon
        x - x coordinate of the left side of the icon
        y - y coordinate of the upper side of the icon

      • setIconAction

        public void setIconAction(javax.swing.Icon icon,
                          java.lang.Object classWithMethod,
                          java.lang.String methodName)
        Set method to be executed when user click on the icon. The method must be without parameters. The class that contains the method must be public and in the same package as the calling code.
        Parameters:
        icon - the icon
        classWithMethod - reference to the class object containing the method to be invoked
        methodName - name of the method to be executed

      • setKeyPressed

        public void setKeyPressed(int key,
                          java.lang.Object classWithMethod,
                          java.lang.String methodName)
        Set method to be executed when user press a key on the keyboard. The method must be without parameters. The class that contains the method must be public and in the same package as the calling code.
        Parameters:
        key - key tied to the action method.
        classWithMethod - reference to the class object containing the method to be invoked
        methodName - name of the method to be executed

      • setKeyReleased

        public void setKeyReleased(int key,
                           java.lang.Object classWithMethod,
                           java.lang.String methodName)
        Set method to be executed when user release a key on the keyboard. The method must be without parameters. The class that contains the method must be public and in the same package as the calling code.
        Parameters:
        key - key tied to the action method.
        classWithMethod - reference to the class object containing the method to be invoked
        methodName - name of the method to be executed

        Parameters:

        Parameters:
        key - key tied to the action method

      • executeAction

        public void executeAction(java.lang.Object classWithAction,
                          java.lang.String methodName)
        Executes a method. A PaintWindow-instance must be visible when executeAction is called. The class that contains the method must be public and in the same package as the calling code.
        Parameters:
        classWithAction - reference to the class object containing the method to be invoked
        methodName - name of the method to be executed

      • line

        public void line(int x1,
                 int y1,
                 int x2,
                 int y2,
                 java.awt.Color color,
                 int lineWidth)
        Draws a line on the background, from (x1,y1) to (x2,y2), in color 'color' and the width 'lineWidth'.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coordinate of the first point
        y1 - y coordinate of the first point
        x2 - x coordinate of the second point
        y2 - y coordinate of the second point
        color - color of the line
        lineWidth - width of the line

      • drawRect

        public void drawRect(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height,
                     java.awt.Color color,
                     int lineWidth)
        Draws a rectangle on the background. The left and the top edges of the rectangle is at 'x' and 'y'.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the rectangle
        y - the y coordinate of the rectangle
        width - the width of the rectangle
        height - the height of the rectangle
        color - the color of the rectangle
        lineWidth - the width of the line

      • fillRect

        public void fillRect(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Draws a filled rectangle on the background. The left and the top edges of the rectangle is at 'x' and 'y'.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the rectangle
        y - the y coordinate of the rectangle
        width - the width of the rectangle
        height - the height of the rectangle
        color - the color of the rectangle

      • drawOval

        public void drawOval(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height,
                     java.awt.Color color,
                     int lineWidth)
        Draws an oval on the background. The result is a ellipse that fits within the rectangle specified by 'x', 'y', 'width' and 'height' arguments
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the rectangle
        y - the y coordinate of the rectangle
        width - the width of the rectangle
        height - the height of the rectangle
        color - the color of the rectangle
        lineWidth - the width of the line

      • fillOval

        public void fillOval(int x,
                     int y,
                     int width,
                     int height,
                     java.awt.Color color)
        Draws a filled oval on the background. The result is a filled ellipse that fits within the rectangle specified by 'x', 'y', 'width' and 'height' arguments
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of the rectangle
        y - the y coordinate of the rectangle
        width - the width of the rectangle
        height - the height of the rectangle
        color - the color of the rectangle
